titleStmt.author: Westerne, Thomas

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: To the worthily honor'd Knight Sir Iohn Salisburie.
analytic.author: Westerne, Thomas

monogr.title: The anuals [sic] of great Brittaine. Or, A most excellent monument : wherein may be seene all the antiquities of this kingdome, to the satisfac ion both of the vniuersities, or any other place stirred with emulation of long continuance. Excellently figured out in a worthy poem
monogr.author: Chester, Robert

div.head: To the worthily honor'd Knight Sir Iohn Salisburie.

lg.l: NOblest of minds, here do the Muses bring
Pure iuice that flow'd from the Pierian springs,
Not filch'd, nor borrow'd, but exhaust
For you infusde in our retentiue braine,
• s now distild thence, through our quilles againe.
Value our verse, as you approue the worth;
And thinke of what they are create,
No Mercenarie hope did bring them forth,
They tread not in that seruile Gate;
But a true Zeale, borne in our spirites,
And an Inuention, freer then the Times,
These were the Parents to our seuerall Rimes,
Wherein Kind, Learned, Enuious, al may view,
That we haue writ worthy our selues and you.
